title: Static Analysis

android.permission.NFC.description: Allows an application to communicate with Near-Field Communication (NFC) tags, cards and readers.

android.permission.VIBRATE.description: Allows the application to control the vibrator.

android.permission.ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE.description: Allows an application to view the status of all networks.

android.permission.ACCESS_WIFI_STATE.description: Allows an application to view the information about the status of Wi-Fi.

android.permission.INTERNET.description: Allows an application to create network sockets.

android.permission.MODIFY_AUDIO_SETTINGS.description: Allows application to modify global audio settings, such as volume and routing.

android.permission.ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION.description: Access fine location sources, such as the Global Positioning System on the phone, where available. Malicious applications can use this to determine where you are and may consume additional battery power.

android.permission.ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATIO.description: Access coarse location sources, such as the mobile network database, to determine an approximate phone location, where available. Malicious applications can use this to determine approximately where you are.

android.permission.QUERY_ALL_PACKAGES.description: Allows query of any normal app on the device, regardless of manifest declarations.

certificate_findings: Application is signed with a code signing certificate

Application is signed with v1 signature scheme, making it vulnerable to Janus vulnerability on Android 5.0-8.0, if signed only with v1 signature scheme. Applications running on Android 5.0-7.0 signed with v1, and v2/v3 scheme is also vulnerable.

nx.description: The shared object does not have NX bit set. NX bit offer protection against exploitation of memory corruption vulnerabilities by marking memory page as non-executable. Use option --noexecstack or -z noexecstack to mark stack as non executable.

stack_canary.description: This shared object does not have a stack canary value added to the stack. Stack canaries are used to detect and prevent exploits from overwriting return address. Use the option -fstack-protector-all to enable stack canaries.

relocation_readonly.description: This shared object does not have RELRO enabled. The entire GOT (.got and .got.plt both) are writable. Without this compiler flag, buffer overflows on a global variable can overwrite GOT entries. Use the option -z,relro,-z,now to enable full RELRO and only -z,relro to enable partial RELRO.

rpath.description: The shared object does not have run-time search path or RPATH set.

runpath.description: The shared object does not have RUNPATH set.

fortify.description: The shared object does not have any fortified functions. Fortified functions provides buffer overflow checks against glibc's commons insecure functions like strcpy, gets etc. Use the compiler option -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 to fortify functions.

metadata.description: Query Database of SMS, Contacts etc

metadata.cwe: CWE-532: Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File
metadata.description: The App logs information. Sensitive information should never be logged.

metadata.cwe: CWE-330: Use of Insufficiently Random Values
metadata.description: The App uses an insecure Random Number Generator.
App creates temp file. Sensitive information should never be written into a temp file.
App can read/write to External Storage. Any App can read data written to External Storage.

metadata.cwe: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
metadata.description: MD5 is a weak hash known to have hash collisions.
This App uses SSL certificate pinning to detect or  prevent MITM attacks in secure communication channel.

FCS_RBG_EXT.1.1.choice: The application implement DRBG functionality for its cryptographic operations.

FCS_STO_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does not store any credentials to non-volatile memory.

FCS_CKM_EXT.1.1.choice: The application implement asymmetric key generation.

FDP_DEC_EXT.1.1.choice: The application has access to ['network connectivity', 'location', 'NFC'].

FDP_DEC_EXT.1.2.choice: The application has access to no sensitive information repositories.

FDP_NET_EXT.1.1.choice: The application has user/application initiated network communications.

FDP_DAR_EXT.1.1.choice: The application implement functionality to encrypt sensitive data in non-volatile memory.

FMT_MEC_EXT.1.1.choice: The application invoke the mechanisms recommended by the platform vendor for storing and setting configuration options.

FTP_DIT_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does encrypt some transmitted data with HTTPS/TLS/SSH between itself and another trusted IT product.

FCS_RBG_EXT.2.1,FCS_RBG_EXT.2.2.choice: The application perform all deterministic random bit generation (DRBG) services in accordance with NIST Special Publication 800-90A using Hash_DRBG. The deterministic RBG is seeded by an entropy source that accumulates entropy from a platform-based DRBG and a software-based noise source, with a minimum of 256 bits of entropy at least equal to the greatest security strength (according to NIST SP 800-57) of the keys and hashes that it will generate.

FCS_CKM.1.1(1).choice: The application generate asymmetric cryptographic keys not in accordance with FCS_CKM.1.1(1) using key generation algorithm RSA schemes and cryptographic key sizes of 1024-bit or lower.

FCS_COP.1.1(2).choice: The application perform cryptographic hashing services not in accordance with FCS_COP.1.1(2) and uses the cryptographic algorithm RC2/RC4/MD4/MD5.

FCS_HTTPS_EXT.1.2.choice: The application implement HTTPS using TLS.

FCS_HTTPS_EXT.1.3.choice: The application notify the user and not establish the connection or request application authorization to establish the connection if the peer certificate is deemed invalid.

FIA_X509_EXT.2.1.choice: The application use X.509v3 certificates as defined by RFC 5280 to support authentication for HTTPS , TLS.

FPT_TUD_EXT.2.1.choice: The application shall be distributed using the format of the platform-supported package manager.

warning.title: Application vulnerable to Janus Vulnerability
warning.description: Application is signed with v1 signature scheme, making it vulnerable to Janus vulnerability on Android 5.0-8.0, if signed only with v1 signature scheme. Applications running on Android 5.0-7.0 signed with v1, and v2/v3 scheme is also vulnerable.

warning.title: The App uses an insecure Random Number Generator.
warning.description:
The App uses an insecure Random Number Generator.
https://github.com/MobSF/owasp-mstg/blob/master/Document/0x04g-Testing-Cryptography.md#weak-random-number-generators

warning.title: App creates temp file. Sensitive information should never be written into a temp file.
warning.description: App creates temp file. Sensitive information should never be written into a temp file.

warning.title: App can read/write to External Storage. Any App can read data written to External Storage.
warning.description:
App can read/write to External Storage. Any App can read data written to External Storage.
https://github.com/MobSF/owasp-mstg/blob/master/Document/0x05d-Testing-Data-Storage.md#external-storage

warning.title: MD5 is a weak hash known to have hash collisions.
warning.description:
MD5 is a weak hash known to have hash collisions.
https://github.com/MobSF/owasp-mstg/blob/master/Document/0x04g-Testing-Cryptography.md#identifying-insecure-andor-deprecated-cryptographic-algorithms-mstg-crypto-4

secure.title: This App uses SSL certificate pinning to detect or  prevent MITM attacks in secure communication channel.
secure.description:
This App uses SSL certificate pinning to detect or  prevent MITM attacks in secure communication channel.
https://github.com/MobSF/owasp-mstg/blob/master/Document/0x05g-Testing-Network-Communication.md#testing-custom-certificate-stores-and-certificate-pinning-mstg-network-4

secure.title: This application has no privacy trackers
secure.description: This application does not include any user or device trackers. Unable to find trackers during static analysis.

hotspot.title: Found 2 critical permission(s)
hotspot.description:
Ensure that these permissions are required by the application.

android.permission.ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION (dangerous): fine (GPS) location - Access fine location sources, such as the Global Positioning System on the phone, where available. Malicious applications can use this to determine where you are and may consume additional battery power.

android.permission.ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION (dangerous): coarse (network-based) location - Access coarse location sources, such as the mobile network database, to determine an approximate phone location, where available. Malicious applications can use this to determine approximately where you are.

hotspot.title: Found 1 certificate/key file(s)
hotspot.description:
Ensure that these files does not contain any private information or sensitive key materials.
